Description: Brown glazed composition shabti of Khay, Lady of the House with black painted detail: a striated lappet-wig, a modelled face, a collar and crossed hands in relief holding two hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs; the back is decorated with a representation of a yoke with two pendular nw-pots and a seed-basket; the back of the leg section is inscribed with two nefer-signs.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
